column1: Truthfulness is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
Lies are the social lubricant that often causes our moral compass to slip.
Honesty is a gift that not everyone can afford.
Deception is a road paved with good intentions leading to a precarious cliff.
An honest heart is a kingdom's strongest fortress.
In a world of illusions, being a liar is akin to being an artist.
Transparency builds trust, while secrets and lies build walls.
Falsifying the truth is like building castles in the air – eventually, they fall.
Speaking the truth might be difficult, but living a lie is torture.
Every lie weaves a web in which the truth gets entangled.
Truthfulness is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.

A single lie can tarnish a thousand truths.
